numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph uses age as a variable.
2. I wonder why the authors chose age as a variable.
3. The graph is very good.
4. The values in the graph increase.
5. Indonesia has a very high result.
6. Brazil has a very low result.
7. Mali has a very low result.
8. I wonder why Indonesia has a high result.
9. I wonder why Brazil has a low result.
10. I wonder why Mali has a low result.
11. Indonesia has a location.
12. Brazil has a location.
13. Mali has a location.
14. I wonder whether the location of Indonesia impacted the result of Indonesia.
15. I wonder whether the location of Brazil impacted the result of Brazil.
16. I wonder whether the location of Mali impacted the result of Mali.
17. I wonder whether these results will change in the future.
18. I wonder how these results compare to results in the past.
19. Many discourses exist about generational attitudes.
20. Some people say that GenZ is more cynical.
21. This graph is a counterpoint to this notion.
22. Some evidence says that the younger generation has worse job security than the baby boomers.
23. Some evidence says that the younger generation has worse home ownership prospects than the baby boomers.
24. The graph displays opinions of people of different ages.
25. The opinions are about whether the world is getting better with each generation.
26. The headline is: Will younger generations help make the world a better place in the future?
